metadata.title: CVE-2021-46671 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
options.c in atftp before 0.7.5 reads past the end of an array, andconsequently discloses server-side /etc/group data to a remote client.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46671` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

atftp - 0.8.0-3
atftpd - 0.8.0-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: atftp package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.8.0-3').
